ARABIC_TEXT: قٓۚ وَٱلۡقُرۡءَانِ ٱلۡمَجِيدِ
TRANSLATION: (1) Qāf.[1524] By the honored Qur’ān...[1525]
FOOTNOTES:
[1524]- See footnote to 2:1.
[1525]- See footnote to 38:1.

ARABIC_TEXT: بَلۡ عَجِبُوٓاْ أَن جَآءَهُم مُّنذِرٞ مِّنۡهُمۡ فَقَالَ ٱلۡكَٰفِرُونَ هَٰذَا شَيۡءٌ عَجِيبٌ
TRANSLATION: (2) But they wonder that there has come to them a warner from among themselves, and the disbelievers say, "This is an amazing thing.

ARABIC_TEXT: أَءِذَا مِتۡنَا وَكُنَّا تُرَابٗاۖ ذَٰلِكَ رَجۡعُۢ بَعِيدٞ
TRANSLATION: (3) When we have died and have become dust, [we will return to life]? That is a distant [i.e., unlikely] return."

ARABIC_TEXT: قَدۡ عَلِمۡنَا مَا تَنقُصُ ٱلۡأَرۡضُ مِنۡهُمۡۖ وَعِندَنَا كِتَٰبٌ حَفِيظُۢ
TRANSLATION: (4) We know what the earth diminishes [i.e., consumes] of them, and with Us is a retaining record.

ARABIC_TEXT: بَلۡ كَذَّبُواْ بِٱلۡحَقِّ لَمَّا جَآءَهُمۡ فَهُمۡ فِيٓ أَمۡرٖ مَّرِيجٍ
TRANSLATION: (5) But they denied the truth when it came to them, so they are in a confused condition.

ARABIC_TEXT: أَفَلَمۡ يَنظُرُوٓاْ إِلَى ٱلسَّمَآءِ فَوۡقَهُمۡ كَيۡفَ بَنَيۡنَٰهَا وَزَيَّنَّٰهَا وَمَا لَهَا مِن فُرُوجٖ
TRANSLATION: (6) Have they not looked at the heaven above them - how We structured it and adorned it and [how] it has no rifts?

ARABIC_TEXT: وَٱلۡأَرۡضَ مَدَدۡنَٰهَا وَأَلۡقَيۡنَا فِيهَا رَوَٰسِيَ وَأَنۢبَتۡنَا فِيهَا مِن كُلِّ زَوۡجِۭ بَهِيجٖ
TRANSLATION: (7) And the earth - We spread it out and cast therein firmly set mountains and made grow therein [something] of every beautiful kind,

ARABIC_TEXT: تَبۡصِرَةٗ وَذِكۡرَىٰ لِكُلِّ عَبۡدٖ مُّنِيبٖ
TRANSLATION: (8) Giving insight and a reminder for every servant who turns [to Allāh].

ARABIC_TEXT: وَنَزَّلۡنَا مِنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ مَآءٗ مُّبَٰرَكٗا فَأَنۢبَتۡنَا بِهِۦ جَنَّٰتٖ وَحَبَّ ٱلۡحَصِيدِ
TRANSLATION: (9) And We have sent down blessed rain from the sky and made grow thereby gardens and grain from the harvest

ARABIC_TEXT: وَٱلنَّخۡلَ بَاسِقَٰتٖ لَّهَا طَلۡعٞ نَّضِيدٞ
TRANSLATION: (10) And lofty palm trees having fruit arranged in layers -

ARABIC_TEXT: رِّزۡقٗا لِّلۡعِبَادِۖ وَأَحۡيَيۡنَا بِهِۦ بَلۡدَةٗ مَّيۡتٗاۚ كَذَٰلِكَ ٱلۡخُرُوجُ
TRANSLATION: (11) As provision for the servants, and We have given life thereby to a dead land. Thus is the emergence [i.e., resurrection].

ARABIC_TEXT: كَذَّبَتۡ قَبۡلَهُمۡ قَوۡمُ نُوحٖ وَأَصۡحَٰبُ ٱلرَّسِّ وَثَمُودُ
TRANSLATION: (12) The people of Noah denied before them,[1526] and the companions of the well[1527] and Thamūd
FOOTNOTES:
[1526]- i.e., before the disbelievers of Makkah.
[1527]- See footnote to 25:38.

ARABIC_TEXT: وَعَادٞ وَفِرۡعَوۡنُ وَإِخۡوَٰنُ لُوطٖ
TRANSLATION: (13) And ʿAad and Pharaoh and the brothers [i.e., people] of Lot

ARABIC_TEXT: وَأَصۡحَٰبُ ٱلۡأَيۡكَةِ وَقَوۡمُ تُبَّعٖۚ كُلّٞ كَذَّبَ ٱلرُّسُلَ فَحَقَّ وَعِيدِ
TRANSLATION: (14) And the companions of the thicket and the people of Tubbaʿ. All denied the messengers, so My threat was justly fulfilled.

ARABIC_TEXT: أَفَعَيِينَا بِٱلۡخَلۡقِ ٱلۡأَوَّلِۚ بَلۡ هُمۡ فِي لَبۡسٖ مِّنۡ خَلۡقٖ جَدِيدٖ
TRANSLATION: (15) Did We fail in the first creation? But they are in confusion over a new creation.

ARABIC_TEXT: وَلَقَدۡ خَلَقۡنَا ٱلۡإِنسَٰنَ وَنَعۡلَمُ مَا تُوَسۡوِسُ بِهِۦ نَفۡسُهُۥۖ وَنَحۡنُ أَقۡرَبُ إِلَيۡهِ مِنۡ حَبۡلِ ٱلۡوَرِيدِ
TRANSLATION: (16) And We have already created man and know what his soul whispers to him, and We are closer[1528] to him than [his] jugular vein.
FOOTNOTES: [1528]- In absolute knowledge of everything about him.  "We" has also been interpreted to mean the angels who are mentioned in the following verse.

ARABIC_TEXT: إِذۡ يَتَلَقَّى ٱلۡمُتَلَقِّيَانِ عَنِ ٱلۡيَمِينِ وَعَنِ ٱلشِّمَالِ قَعِيدٞ
TRANSLATION: (17) When the two receivers [i.e., recording angels] receive,[1529] seated on the right and on the left.
FOOTNOTES: [1529]- And record each word and deed.

ARABIC_TEXT: مَّا يَلۡفِظُ مِن قَوۡلٍ إِلَّا لَدَيۡهِ رَقِيبٌ عَتِيدٞ
TRANSLATION: (18) He [i.e., man] utters no word except that with him is an observer prepared [to record].

ARABIC_TEXT: وَجَآءَتۡ سَكۡرَةُ ٱلۡمَوۡتِ بِٱلۡحَقِّۖ ذَٰلِكَ مَا كُنتَ مِنۡهُ تَحِيدُ
TRANSLATION: (19) And the intoxication of death will bring the truth; that is what you were trying to avoid.

ARABIC_TEXT: وَنُفِخَ فِي ٱلصُّورِۚ ذَٰلِكَ يَوۡمُ ٱلۡوَعِيدِ
TRANSLATION: (20) And the Horn will be blown. That is the Day of [carrying out] the threat.

ARABIC_TEXT: وَجَآءَتۡ كُلُّ نَفۡسٖ مَّعَهَا سَآئِقٞ وَشَهِيدٞ
TRANSLATION: (21) And every soul will come, with it a driver and a witness.[1530]
FOOTNOTES: [1530]- i.e., one angel driving the soul to the Judgement and one to testify as to its deeds.

ARABIC_TEXT: لَّقَدۡ كُنتَ فِي غَفۡلَةٖ مِّنۡ هَٰذَا فَكَشَفۡنَا عَنكَ غِطَآءَكَ فَبَصَرُكَ ٱلۡيَوۡمَ حَدِيدٞ
TRANSLATION: (22) [It will be said], "You were certainly in unmindfulness of this, and We have removed from you your cover,[1531] so your sight, this Day, is sharp."
FOOTNOTES: [1531]- Of heedlessness, or that which had sealed your hearing, your vision and your heart from guidance.

ARABIC_TEXT: وَقَالَ قَرِينُهُۥ هَٰذَا مَا لَدَيَّ عَتِيدٌ
TRANSLATION: (23) And his companion, [the angel], will say, "This [record] is what is with me, prepared."

ARABIC_TEXT: أَلۡقِيَا فِي جَهَنَّمَ كُلَّ كَفَّارٍ عَنِيدٖ
TRANSLATION: (24) [Allāh will say], "Throw into Hell every obstinate disbeliever,

ARABIC_TEXT: مَّنَّاعٖ لِّلۡخَيۡرِ مُعۡتَدٖ مُّرِيبٍ
TRANSLATION: (25) Preventer of good, aggressor, and doubter,

ARABIC_TEXT: ٱلَّذِي جَعَلَ مَعَ ٱللَّهِ إِلَٰهًا ءَاخَرَ فَأَلۡقِيَاهُ فِي ٱلۡعَذَابِ ٱلشَّدِيدِ
TRANSLATION: (26) Who made [as equal] with Allāh another deity; then throw him into the severe punishment."

ARABIC_TEXT: ۞ قَالَ قَرِينُهُۥ رَبَّنَا مَآ أَطۡغَيۡتُهُۥ وَلَٰكِن كَانَ فِي ضَلَٰلِۭ بَعِيدٖ
TRANSLATION: (27) His [devil] companion will say, "Our Lord, I did not make him transgress, but he [himself] was in extreme error."

ARABIC_TEXT: قَالَ لَا تَخۡتَصِمُواْ لَدَيَّ وَقَدۡ قَدَّمۡتُ إِلَيۡكُم بِٱلۡوَعِيدِ
TRANSLATION: (28) [Allāh] will say, "Do not dispute before Me, while I had already presented to you the threat [i.e., warning].

ARABIC_TEXT: مَا يُبَدَّلُ ٱلۡقَوۡلُ لَدَيَّ وَمَآ أَنَا۠ بِظَلَّٰمٖ لِّلۡعَبِيدِ
TRANSLATION: (29) The word [i.e., decree] will not be changed with Me, and never will I be unjust to the servants."

ARABIC_TEXT: يَوۡمَ نَقُولُ لِجَهَنَّمَ هَلِ ٱمۡتَلَأۡتِ وَتَقُولُ هَلۡ مِن مَّزِيدٖ
TRANSLATION: (30) On the Day We will say to Hell, "Have you been filled?" and it will say, "Are there some more,"

ARABIC_TEXT: وَأُزۡلِفَتِ ٱلۡجَنَّةُ لِلۡمُتَّقِينَ غَيۡرَ بَعِيدٍ
TRANSLATION: (31) And Paradise will be brought near to the righteous, not far,

ARABIC_TEXT: هَٰذَا مَا تُوعَدُونَ لِكُلِّ أَوَّابٍ حَفِيظٖ
TRANSLATION: (32) [It will be said], "This is what you were promised - for every returner [to Allāh] and keeper [of His covenant].

ARABIC_TEXT: مَّنۡ خَشِيَ ٱلرَّحۡمَٰنَ بِٱلۡغَيۡبِ وَجَآءَ بِقَلۡبٖ مُّنِيبٍ
TRANSLATION: (33) Who feared the Most Merciful in the unseen and came with a heart returning [in repentance].

ARABIC_TEXT: ٱدۡخُلُوهَا بِسَلَٰمٖۖ ذَٰلِكَ يَوۡمُ ٱلۡخُلُودِ
TRANSLATION: (34) Enter it in peace. This is the Day of Eternity."

ARABIC_TEXT: لَهُم مَّا يَشَآءُونَ فِيهَا وَلَدَيۡنَا مَزِيدٞ
TRANSLATION: (35) They will have whatever they wish therein, and with Us is more.

ARABIC_TEXT: وَكَمۡ أَهۡلَكۡنَا قَبۡلَهُم مِّن قَرۡنٍ هُمۡ أَشَدُّ مِنۡهُم بَطۡشٗا فَنَقَّبُواْ فِي ٱلۡبِلَٰدِ هَلۡ مِن مَّحِيصٍ
TRANSLATION: (36) And how many a generation before them did We destroy who were greater than them in [striking] power and had explored throughout the lands. Is there any place of escape?

ARABIC_TEXT: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَذِكۡرَىٰ لِمَن كَانَ لَهُۥ قَلۡبٌ أَوۡ أَلۡقَى ٱلسَّمۡعَ وَهُوَ شَهِيدٞ
TRANSLATION: (37) Indeed in that is a reminder for whoever has a heart or who listens while he is present [in mind].

ARABIC_TEXT: وَلَقَدۡ خَلَقۡنَا ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضَ وَمَا بَيۡنَهُمَا فِي سِتَّةِ أَيَّامٖ وَمَا مَسَّنَا مِن لُّغُوبٖ
TRANSLATION: (38) And We did certainly create the heavens and earth and what is between them in six days, and there touched Us no weariness.

ARABIC_TEXT: فَٱصۡبِرۡ عَلَىٰ مَا يَقُولُونَ وَسَبِّحۡ بِحَمۡدِ رَبِّكَ قَبۡلَ طُلُوعِ ٱلشَّمۡسِ وَقَبۡلَ ٱلۡغُرُوبِ
TRANSLATION: (39) So be patient, [O Muḥammad], over what they say and exalt [Allāh] with praise of your Lord before the rising of the sun and before its setting,

ARABIC_TEXT: وَمِنَ ٱلَّيۡلِ فَسَبِّحۡهُ وَأَدۡبَٰرَ ٱلسُّجُودِ
TRANSLATION: (40) And [in part] of the night exalt Him and after prostration [i.e., prayer].

ARABIC_TEXT: وَٱسۡتَمِعۡ يَوۡمَ يُنَادِ ٱلۡمُنَادِ مِن مَّكَانٖ قَرِيبٖ
TRANSLATION: (41) And listen on the Day when the Caller[1532] will call out from a place that is near -
FOOTNOTES: [1532]- An angel who will call out Allāh's command for the Resurrection.

ARABIC_TEXT: يَوۡمَ يَسۡمَعُونَ ٱلصَّيۡحَةَ بِٱلۡحَقِّۚ ذَٰلِكَ يَوۡمُ ٱلۡخُرُوجِ
TRANSLATION: (42) The Day they will hear the blast [of the Horn] in truth. That is the Day of Emergence [from the graves].

ARABIC_TEXT: إِنَّا نَحۡنُ نُحۡيِۦ وَنُمِيتُ وَإِلَيۡنَا ٱلۡمَصِيرُ
TRANSLATION: (43) Indeed, it is We who give life and cause death, and to Us is the destination

ARABIC_TEXT: يَوۡمَ تَشَقَّقُ ٱلۡأَرۡضُ عَنۡهُمۡ سِرَاعٗاۚ ذَٰلِكَ حَشۡرٌ عَلَيۡنَا يَسِيرٞ
TRANSLATION: (44) On the Day the earth breaks away from them [and they emerge] rapidly; that is a gathering easy for Us.

ARABIC_TEXT: نَّحۡنُ أَعۡلَمُ بِمَا يَقُولُونَۖ وَمَآ أَنتَ عَلَيۡهِم بِجَبَّارٖۖ فَذَكِّرۡ بِٱلۡقُرۡءَانِ مَن يَخَافُ وَعِيدِ
TRANSLATION: (45) We are most knowing of what they say, and you are not over them a tyrant.[1533] But remind by the Qur’ān whoever fears My threat.
FOOTNOTES: [1533]- Forcing people to belief or submission.
